message.content: In this scenario, the boy is currently walking due north based on the direction indicated by the arrow on the compass. However, he knows that his house is to the south of him. To head towards his house, the boy needs to change direction completely and start walking in the opposite direction. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) turns around. Options (A) and (B) suggest changing direction but without turning around completely. Option (D) suggests continuing to walk in the same direction, which would take the boy farther away from his house.

This question requires an understanding of compass directions and how they relate to cardinal directions. The boy is currently facing north, but he knows that his house is to the south of him. To reach his house, he needs to turn around and face south. Therefore, the correct answer is option (C) turns around. Option (A) turns right and option (B) turns left would not align the boy with the south direction. Option (D) keeps straight would also not align the boy with the south direction.

This question requires some basic knowledge about compass directions and how they relate to cardinal directions. If the boy is facing north and his house is to the south, he needs to turn around 180 degrees to face south and start walking towards his house. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) turns around.

Option (A) is incorrect because turning right would make him face east, not towards his house. Option (B) is incorrect because turning left would make him face west, not towards his house. Option (D) is incorrect because keeping straight would still make him continue walking north, away from his house.

To solve this question, we need to understand how a compass works and how the directions are represented on a compass. In this scenario, the boy knows that his house is to the south of him, but the arrow on his compass is pointing due north. This means that the boy is facing in the opposite direction of his house.

To find his way back home, the boy needs to turn around and walk in the opposite direction. Option (C) "turns around" is the correct answer because by doing so, the boy will be facing south and will be able to head towards his house. Option (A) "turns right" and Option (B) "turns left" would not be the correct choices as they would not redirect the boy towards his house. Option (D) "keeps straight" is also incorrect as it would cause the boy to keep walking in the wrong direction away from his house.

Option (A) turns right and option (B) turns left would not be correct because they would not change the boy's direction from north to south. Option (D) keeps straight would also not be correct because it would continue to take the boy in the direction of north, away from his house.

This means that the boy is currently facing in the opposite direction of where he wants to go.
